The main purpose of these rules is to simplify trigonometric calculations so that they can be done by hand, and this is usually done by splitting the equation into smaller parts each with a trigonometric function that we can compute. and the  angles that we know the exact value of without using a calculator are (30,45,60,90,120,135,150,180,210,225,240,270,300,315,330,360). so we would try to split it into 2 functions that use any of these numbers so in the case of 105 we would split it into 45+60 since these are both numbers we already know the value of from the unit circle
Yes it is correct, but you take out the 4 in the denominator and it becomes cos (pi/8) = (sqrt(2+(sqrt2)))/2
